column1: Nala was in her room ready to sleep. Nala wants to have a good night's sleep without any nightmares. The door to Nala's room is locked.
column2: Does Nala think the door to her room is locked or unlocked?
column3: Nala believes the door to her room is unlocked.
column4: Nala believes the door to her room is locked.

column1: Hugo was in the park with his friends. Hugo wanted to win the kite flying contest. The string of Hugo's kite was strong.
column2: Does Hugo think the string of his kite is strong or weak?
column3: Hugo believes the string of his kite is weak.
column4: Hugo believes the string of his kite is strong.

column1: Ravi was at the fish market. Ravi wanted to buy a fish for his mom to cook for dinner. The fish on the scale was heavy.
column2: Does Ravi believe the fish on the scale is heavy or light?
column3: Ravi believes the fish on the scale is light.
column4: Ravi believes the fish on the scale is heavy.

column1: Vito was at a birthday party. Vito wanted to give his friend a special gift. The gift was wrapped in a shiny paper.
column2: Does Vito think the gift is wrapped or unwrapped?
column3: Vito believes the gift is unwrapped.
column4: Vito believes the gift is wrapped.

column1: Tim was in the kitchen, ready to make lunch. Tim wanted to make a big bowl of pasta. The pasta box was full.
column2: Does Tim think the pasta box is full or not?
column3: Tim believes the pasta box is not full.
column4: Tim believes the pasta box is full.

column1: Wendy was in the park, sitting on a bench. Wendy wanted to play a charming tune on her small flute. The flute was in her bag.
column2: Does Wendy think her flute is in her bag or in the lost and found box?
column3: Wendy believes her flute is in the lost and found box.
column4: Wendy believes her flute is in her bag.

column1: Gigi was at the park with her friends. Gigi wanted to share her mints with her friends. The mint box was full of fat, healthy mints.
column2: Does Gigi think the mints in the box are fat and healthy or nibbled and sickly?
column3: Gigi believes the mints in the box are nibbled and sickly.
column4: Gigi believes the mints in the box are fat and healthy.

column1: Remy was in the park playing with his colorful parrot. Remy wanted his parrot to learn a new trick. The parrot was sitting on a clear and open branch.
column2: Does Remy think his parrot is sitting on a clear and open branch or an obscured branch?
column3: Remy believes his parrot is sitting on an obscured branch.
column4: Remy believes his parrot is sitting on a clear and open branch.
column5: the branch the parrot is sitting on

column1: Pete was at the park, ready to eat his lunch. Pete wanted to enjoy his food while watching the birds. The food in Pete's lunch box was fresh and yummy.
column2: Does Pete think his food is fresh and yummy or bitten by a squirrel?
column3: Pete believes his food has been bitten by a squirrel.
column4: Pete believes his food is fresh and yummy.

column1: Quin was in the park with his gray paint and brush. Quin wanted to paint a big tree on a big balloon. The balloon was empty.
column2: Does Quin think the balloon is empty or filled with air?
column3: Quin believes the balloon is filled with air.
column4: Quin believes the balloon is empty.

column1: Yara was at a party with her friends. Yara wanted to sing her favorite song for everyone. The microphone was working fine.
column2: Does Yara think the microphone is working fine or has stopped working?
column3: Yara believes the microphone has stopped working.
column4: Yara believes the microphone is working fine.

column1: Sam was at the space station, waiting to travel back to Earth. Sam wants to return home to see his family. The spaceship's launch schedule was synchronized with Earth's rotation.
column2: Does Sam believe the spaceship's launch schedule is synchronized or asynchronous with Earth's rotation?
column3: Sam believes the spaceship's launch schedule is asynchronous with Earth's rotation.
column4: Sam believes the spaceship's launch schedule is synchronized with Earth's rotation.

column1: Ina was at the park, sitting on a gray bench. Ina wanted to solve the puzzle in her story book. The puzzle in the story book was hard.
column2: Does Ina think the puzzle in the story book is hard or solved?
column3: Ina believes the puzzle in the story book is solved.
column4: Ina believes the puzzle in the story book is hard.

column1: Lenny was at the market to buy a smelly cheese. Lenny wanted to find the best smelly cheese for his mom. The cheese was very expensive.
column2: Does Lenny think the cheese is expensive or damaged and therefore less expensive?
column3: Lenny believes the cheese is damaged and therefore less expensive.
column4: Lenny believes the cheese is very expensive.

column1: Kip was at the mall looking at a beautiful painting. Kip wanted to buy the painting to put it in his room. The painting was very expensive.
column2: Does Kip think the painting is very expensive or on sale?
column3: Kip believes the painting is on sale.
column4: Kip believes the painting is very expensive.

column1: Jake was in the kitchen ready to make dinner. Jake wanted to make a big salad with all the fresh groceries he bought. The knife he uses to cut veggies was very sharp.
column2: Does Jake think the knife is sharp or dull?
column3: Jake believes the knife is dull.
column4: Jake believes the knife is sharp.

column1: Yara was in the kitchen making a sandwich. Yara wanted to find the peanut butter in the cupboard to spread on her bread. The cupboard door was flat and straight.
column2: Does Yara think the cupboard door is flat and straight or warped?
column3: Yara believes the cupboard door is warped.
column4: Yara believes the cupboard door is flat and straight.

column1: Dora was at the library looking for a fun book to read. Dora wants to find a book that will make her laugh. The book Dora wants is on the top shelf.
column2: Does Dora think the book she wants is on the top shelf or on the floor?
column3: Dora believes the book she wants is on the floor.
column4: Dora believes the book she wants is on the top shelf.

column1: Xander was in the forest, looking for deer. Xander wanted to find a deer to take a picture. The deer was hidden in the bushes.
column2: Does Xander think the deer is hidden in the bushes or running out in the open?
column3: Xander believes the deer is running out in the open.
column4: Xander believes the deer is hidden in the bushes.

column1: Remy was at the park playing with his toy car. Remy wants to stay at the park until the sun goes down. The toy car was fully charged.
column2: Does Remy think his toy car is fully charged or drained?
column3: Remy believes his toy car is drained.
column4: Remy believes his toy car is fully charged.

column1: Ed was at the airport waiting for his flight. Ed wanted to finish his book before his flight. The bottle of water Ed had was full.
column2: Does Ed think his bottle of water is full or empty?
column3: Ed believes his bottle of water is empty.
column4: Ed believes his bottle of water is full.

column1: Caden was at the park playing with his friends. Caden wanted to show his friends his new toy lizard. The toy lizard was clean and shiny.
column2: Does Caden think his toy lizard is clean and shiny or dirty?
column3: Caden believes his toy lizard is dirty.
column4: Caden believes his toy lizard is clean and shiny.

column1: Tilly was in the park, sitting on a bench. Tilly wanted to feed the humble rat that visited her every day. The rat was in its hole, not coming out.
column2: Does Tilly think the rat is in its hole or scared away?
column3: Tilly believes the rat is scared away.
column4: Tilly believes the rat is in its hole.

column1: Fergus was at the park playing fetch with his dog. Fergus wants to get his dog to fetch a long stick. The stick was lying on the ground.
column2: Does Fergus think the stick is on the ground or has it become lighter?
column3: Fergus believes the stick has become lighter.
column4: Fergus believes the stick is on the ground.

column1: Gabe was at the park with his lovely new cart. Gabe wanted to decorate his cart with shiny stickers. The cart was clean and ready for decoration.
column2: Does Gabe think his cart is clean and ready for decoration or dusty and dirty?
column3: Gabe believes his cart is dusty and dirty.
column4: Gabe believes his cart is clean and ready for decoration.

column1: Darius was in his art class, drawing his favorite tree. Darius wanted to make his tree look real with brown ink. The ink bottle on Darius's table was full.
column2: Does Darius think the ink in the bottle is full and fluid or dry and hard?
column3: Darius believes the ink in the bottle is dry and hard.
column4: Darius believes the ink in the bottle is full and fluid.

column1: Kiki was at the beach with her metal detector. Kiki wanted to collect any gold she could find. The sand was cool and undisturbed.
column2: Does Kiki think the sand is cool and undisturbed or kicked up and disturbed?
column3: Kiki believes the sand is kicked up and disturbed.
column4: Kiki believes the sand is cool and undisturbed.

column1: Xander was in the kitchen making breakfast. Xander wanted to make a good omelette for his mom. The egg in the pan was not cooked yet.
column2: Does Xander think the egg is still not cooked or partially cooked?
column3: Xander believes the egg is partially cooked.
column4: Xander believes the egg is still not cooked.

column1: Yara was at a factory on a tour with her school friends. Yara wants to learn about how ice cream is made. The ice cream mix in the big vat was thick and creamy.
column2: Does Yara think the ice cream mix is thick and creamy or frozen?
column3: Yara believes the ice cream mix is now frozen.
column4: Yara believes the ice cream mix is still thick and creamy.
column5: ice cream mix in the vat

column1: Sam was in the kitchen making a cake. Sam wanted to wash his hands before he started to bake. The sink in the kitchen was clean.
column2: Does Sam think the sink is clean or dirty?
column3: Sam believes the sink is dirty.
column4: Sam believes the sink is clean.

column1: Adam was in his lab working on his science project. Adam wanted to finish his project before the end of the day. The lab clock was synchronized with the school's main clock.
column2: Does Adam believe the lab clock is synchronized with the school's main clock or asynchronous?
column3: Adam believes the lab clock is asynchronous with the school's main clock.
column4: Adam believes the lab clock is synchronized with the school's main clock.

column1: Ollie was in the kitchen ready to make dinner. Ollie wanted to cut some veggies for a fine soup. The knife was sharp and ready to use.
column2: Does Ollie think the knife is sharp or dull?
column3: Ollie believes the knife is dull.
column4: Ollie believes the knife is sharp.

column1: Benny was at the park near the harmless creek. Benny wanted to sing a new song he just learned. The creek was quiet and restful.
column2: Does Benny think the creek is quiet and restful or disruptive?
column3: Benny believes the creek is disruptive.
column4: Benny believes the creek is quiet and restful.

column1: Lenny was in a subway station waiting for his train. Lenny wanted to share his lunch with a friend who was also taking the subway. The tracks for the subway were aligned.
column2: Does Lenny think the subway tracks are aligned or misaligned?
column3: Lenny believes the subway tracks were misaligned but are now aligned.
column4: Lenny believes the subway tracks are aligned.

column1: Xander was in the park playing a game of knights with his friends. Xander wanted to be the best knight and protect his friends with his shield. The shield Xander was using was made of cardboard and was originally opaque.
column2: Does Xander think his shield is opaque or transparent?
column3: Xander believes his shield is transparent.
column4: Xander believes his shield is opaque.

column1: Noah was at a busy coffee shop waiting for his friend. Noah wanted to buy a coffee and sit with his friend. The coffee machine was working well.
column2: Does Noah think the coffee machine is working or not working?
column3: Noah believes the coffee machine is not working.
column4: Noah believes the coffee machine is working.

column1: Yesterday, Yara was playing with her favorite toy car in the kitchen. She wanted to make the car do a big jump over the sink. The drain in the sink was closed.
column2: Does Yara think the drain is open or closed?
column3: Yara believes the drain is open.
column4: Yara believes the drain is closed.

column1: Vito was at a park, watching the birds. Vito wanted to sit on the park bench and enjoy his lunch. The bench was dry and clean.
column2: Does Vito think the bench is dry or wet?
column3: Vito believes the bench is wet.
column4: Vito believes the bench is dry.

column1: Dan was in the park for his morning jog. Dan wanted to finish his jog and pick some fresh radishes from the park's garden. The ice cream cone sitting on the park bench was solid.
column2: Does Dan think the ice cream is solid or melted?
column3: Dan believes the ice cream is melted.
column4: Dan believes the ice cream is solid.
column5: ice cream cone on the park bench

column1: Finn was at the beach, ready for a swim. Finn wanted to swim in the sea where the popular shark named "Bubbles" was known to play. The shark cage was open.
column2: Does Finn think the shark cage is open or closed?
column3: Finn believes the shark cage is closed.
column4: Finn believes the shark cage is open.

column1: Hana was at the park playing with her kite. Hana wants to fly her kite high up in the sky. The cable on Hana's kite is tied tightly.
column2: Does Hana think the cable on her kite is tied tightly or loosened?
column3: Hana believes the cable on her kite is loosened.
column4: Hana believes the cable on her kite is tied tightly.

column1: Max was at the park ready to play. Max wanted to play a fun game of hide and seek. The rag he used as a marker was neatly folded on the bench.
column2: Does Max think the rag is neatly folded or messy?
column3: Max believes the rag is messy.
column4: Max believes the rag is neatly folded.

column1: Uri was in the music room at school. Uri wanted to play a harmless prank on his friend. The piano in the music room was light.
column2: Does Uri believe the piano is light or heavy?
column3: Uri believes the piano is heavy.
column4: Uri believes the piano is light.

column1: Yara was at a park playing with her green ball. Yara wanted to play catch with her dad. The ball was very bouncy.
column2: Does Yara think her ball is very bouncy or less bouncy?
column3: Yara believes her ball is less bouncy.
column4: Yara believes her ball is very bouncy.

column1: Tia was at the park playing with her toy cart. Tia wanted to push her cart down the hill and watch it roll. The cart's wheels were tight and good for rolling.
column2: Does Tia think the cart's wheels are tight and good for rolling or loose and not rolling well?
column3: Tia believes the cart's wheel is loose and not rolling well.
column4: Tia believes the cart's wheels are tight and good for rolling.

column1: Val was in the kitchen getting ready for a party. Val wanted to make a cold drink for her friends. The metal tie she used to wrap the ice was cold and conductive.
column2: Does Val think the metal tie is cold and conductive or warm and conductive?
column3: Val believes the metal tie is warm and conductive.
column4: Val believes the metal tie is cold and conductive.

column1: Flora was in her classroom, waiting for her friends to play a game. Flora wanted to play a game of twist-the-bottle. The cap on the bottle was twisted tight.
column2: Does Flora think the cap on the bottle is twisted or untwisted?
column3: Flora believes the cap on the bottle is untwisted.
column4: Flora believes the cap on the bottle is twisted.

column1: Gus was at the park drawing pictures with his crayons. Gus wanted to draw a big, beautiful rainbow. The box of crayons was full of many colors.
column2: Does Gus believe the box of crayons is full or spilled out?
column3: Gus believes the box of crayons has spilled out.
column4: Gus believes the box of crayons is full.

column1: Gabe was at the park playing with his toy magnet. Gabe wanted to show his friends how his toy magnet could pick up small metal pieces. The toy magnet was very strong.
column2: Does Gabe think his toy magnet is strong or weak?
column3: Gabe believes his toy magnet is weak.
column4: Gabe believes his toy magnet is strong.
